intro: Pavetta smythei, commonly known as the Hawaiian pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forests and along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Pavetta smythei is considered a rare and endemic species.
